This would be great but it’s too long and runs small

The fit was overall a little weird. Definitely didn’t look great buttoned unfortunately. I just left it unbuttoned with jeans and a tee. I’m pretty petite so I had to cuff the sleeves. I’d say save your precious nuuly picks for somethin’ else.

links_reviews_title: A dream pant for tall folks
links_reviews_text: For someone who is 5'10'' with a 35" inseam - these pants are PERFECT. I have a small waist and larger hips/thighs and the Large fits really well. Maybe you could pin them, but that would mess up the beautiful drape. I own a black velvet blazer - so now my velvet suit dreams are coming true!
Too long to wear out of the house

I ordered a size medium but definitely should’ve gone with the small. However the length was a problem too. I have pretty long legs and I don’t usually have an issue with pants being too long but these dragged on the floor even with a high heel. Unfortunately I couldn’t wear them.

links_reviews_title: Odd fit. The zipper was slightly crooked.

a typical jean, easy to wear

The quality was ok and the sizing was ok, I just didn't like the rise of the jean, I'd have liked it to be a little higher, but there weren't a lot of high rise options available at the time

Maybe I just ordered a size or two too big but these were just NOT flattering. I tried wearing them a couple of times and just couldn't leave the house in them, they were that awful. AND they did indeed smell funny like another reviewer mentioned ... like mothballs. Yuck.

Very comfortable. Not particularly flattering.

I highly recommend them if you’re looking for a relaxed jean.

liked it but the jeans had an odd smell when they arrived - stale ?

links_reviews_title: Never thought I would love myself in this dress
links_reviews_text: If you have an inkling of wanting to try this dress, DO IT. OMG. Looking at this dress online I never thought I would like let alone LOVE how I looked in this dress. I do not usually wear tight dresses that show alot of leg/back/etc., but it was so gorgeous and unique I had to give it a try. I wore it out in Vegas and it was so comfortable! The fabric is pretty light and breezy and not bodycon/shaping at all, so it worked well with spanx underneath (except they have to be short enough to not poke through the leg slit). The dress definitely wrinkles so you may wish to steam/iron it. The high leg detail is SO sexy. It looks adjustable but it's not; the fabric is ruched up with a string ribbon. I am 5' 6'' and the slit was juuuuuust a touch too short for me, but that's also due to my preference. The sheer sleeves are really cute too. The back is basically a big tie so be wary about the bra/no bra dilemma as your back bra strap will most likely show.

Sometimes For Love and Lemons runs small but this did not at all, was a bit baggy so I should have stuck with my usual medium. The loose fit wasn't super obvious and the ties in the back helped. Very comfortable, love the adjustable slit. Wore it with cowboy boots and the Levi Legend denim jacket to a wine country saloon on a bachelorette party night out. Material is very thin but didn't look cheap, several compliments!
Unfortunately, this dress can't be worn with a bra (despite others saying it can be), and I can't go bra-less. It's a cute dress, but if you're above a D, not recommended.

Also if you are flat chested like me, you will find it to be roomy and a little bit more poofy (not really saggy) in the front. Sadly, it was freezing the day I wore it and could only find photos of my turtleneck and jacket over it so I did not get a proper picture of the dress on.

This fit amazing. You can adjust the thigh sexiness as well. The models on this site are much taller than the average woman, and the dress came down to my calves, still a flattering fit. It was a little tight in the back/shoulders/arms, but fit like a dream everywhere else.
Super flattering. I loved this dress.
Such a pretty dress that can easily be dressed up with a pair of heels or dressed down with booties and a leather jacket. Either way; I highly recommend!

Absolutely obsessed with this dress! I have never received so many compliments on a dress and I've worn a lotttt of good dresses haha.. Do yourself a favor and RENT THIS. Even if you have nowhere to wear it - rent it and wear it around your home.

I love this dress! Everything about it is so fun - the pattern, the slit, the puffy shoulders, the open back. I rented it for my sister's bridal shower and it was a hit. I got a M because the S wasn't available and it was definitely too big, the back hung down way too low but I just rolled with it. I didn't wear it again throughout the month because of this, though. Definitely renting again in a smaller size in the future!
Loved this FLL dress. Their sizing makes me nervous but the XS was perfect. I am 5’9” and the slit was sexy, but it wasn’t too short. So many compliments!

Wore this to a wedding and got tons of compliments! The back is the best part- you can probably get away with wearing a normal bra but I don’t want to have to worry about it showing while dancing so wore a sticky bra.
Fancier than I thought. But still great!
Loved this dress so much, it fit like a glove and got so many compliments!
I put a plain black belt with it. Perfect for early fall wedding
obsessed with this dress - i was nervous about FL&L sizing and sized up - could have ordered my regular size, but still fit

I love For Love and Lemons brand and this dress did not disappoint. The dress was super stylish and the slit on one side as well as the open back definitely make this long sleeved dress sexy. The dress still worked out great though because the back ties and is adjustable.
This dress fit so well!
It is so comfortable and such a beautifully made dress! It is super thin with delicate fabric so a good Summer to Fall transition piece.
This is lovely. The skit in the front is perfection. I love the cap sleeves and open back. Form fitting but also flows.
Wore it to a wedding and got so many compliments. It's different, beautiful print, love the open back!

links_reviews_title: Loved! perfect for an evening occasion
links_reviews_text: Absolutely loved this versatile dress. The tie at the back also made the sizing flexible in a good way. I ended up wearing this even more than I thought. Lots of compliments! Highly recommend :)

links_reviews_title: Hot as Hell Date Night Dress
links_reviews_text: This is my favorite dress from my Nuuly box for September. There are so many pretty details, (ruching on the arms, split up front with bow, omg and the back!) The style is sexy but classy, and super flattering.
This dress is fab. It's flattering. It can be worn with a bra, and still has a dramatic back. I wore it to a wedding and received tons of compliments.

links_reviews_title: So pretty and perfect for date night!
links_reviews_text: FLL typically runs small so I went with a large over my typical medium and wish I stuck with the medium. The large worked by tying the back bow extra tight but medium definitely would've fit better. Love this dress though!!!

Love this dress should have ordered the large but all they had was xl which is ok. The chest is adjustable with the tie. The buttons on the neck however were a little big but my hair covered them so no biggie. Love the slit and my husband loves this dress. Thinking about buying and having the shoulders and neck altered. I’m a 34DD and the chest was perfect with a little room. Bonus bra strap doesn’t show.
I loved this and sad I did't get a chance to wear it. Fit TTS and would order again.

When do you get both in one dress? I almost *never* wear dresses because I'm a yogi and basically a 5-year-old in an adults body – I'm constantly moving and inverting and need my clothes to be comfortable, even if I don't plan on doing handstands. This dress was a d r e a m . Gorgeous. Sexy. Felt great, looked great.
I’m tiny and this took time to pull it on. Very tight and can’t walk in it. Could be cute for a photo shoot. Can’t see how I can wear this out.

Really wanted to rent for a bachelorette party in Miami and so happy I did! I am typically a Small but only a Medium was available. I decided to go for it since the fabric is so stretchy and the fit was perfect! I am also on the shorter side and was still happy with the length. Highly recommend!
Fit me perfectly, felt very sexy! Definitely on the longer side, but great with heels😉
Couldn’t wear this one because our vacation got canceled because of covid-19, but highly recommend. Very sexy but not like overly revealing.
I ordered it again.... JUST IN CASE I had a fab event planned. I loved it so much the first time I ordered it. It’s super sexy, without feeling over exposed. FIVE STARS⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Super flattering, classy, and sexy date night dress
Perfect for night out in Vegas!!
Cute but would have preferred a size up.
This fit like a glove! Really flattering. Perfect LBD.
This dress was so incredibly flattering and well made! True to size, didn’t need to wear a bra, and super comfy.
Wore this dress for Valentine’s Day. A little too sexy for my taste but it fit well.
This dress was everything. I wore it multiple times and always got a ton of compliments. It's sexy and flattering.

I generally feel like For Love and Lemons runs a bit small - I rented this in a medium just because I really wanted it for a trip and decided to take my chances. The medium was a challenge to get on but it fit pretty well once it was on. Definitely would get a large next time though! It's super sexy and different - I loved the skirt and the lace.

I wore this dress to a wedding and would totally rent again for another event. Im typically a XS or S in their stuff, I got a small and it fit like a glove! It is very tight/form fitting but does stretch. Definitely slip it on before doing your makeup! haha. My only complaint is that I had to pull the slip down while dancing a few times. A really beautiful dress and got tons of compliments!
Not the best for a full chest, no support.

I would have bought this dress if the discount was bigger at the end of the month. The dress was very body contouring. The top half has a string around the “bikini“ top. So I could let out the cinching on the top to allow for more coverage. All in all it’s a smokin’ dress. I wish I could hold it back one month to keep in my box for next rotation. NUULY- If you were listening I would like to suggest that in your program.
No bra required, my kind of dress! Runs a tad small but my typical size Small still worked.

I wore this dress for New Year’s Eve and loved everything about it. It’s super flattering and surprisingly comfortable. There’s an elastic waist band that’s tight enough to make the waist look great, but it doesn’t feel like you’re being suffocated. I got so many compliments on it and would definitely wear it again.

I am obsessed with this dress! It was so flattering. Sexy but also chic. I felt elegant but also like I could throw on a leather or denim jacket and go out on the town. I definitely would buy this one!
felt great in this dress. only nite is that for a shorter person like me (with short legs), the bottom was a little constraining around my calf area. loved the lace back and stretch.

I ordered this dress to wear on my birthday and I never felt more beautiful! It fit in all the right places - I loved how high up the band went below the bra part of this dress, and the bunching on the sides made it look flawless. 10/10 would recommend for a sexy night out!!
Never wore because the occasion never came up, but very sexy dress and flattering. Would wear to a fancy event

Oh my gosh this dress is beautiful! It does run tight but not too tight... just tight enough. I am not curvy at all and yet somehow this dress accentuates what little curve I have. I wore this dress multiple times on my vacation to Mexico! Absolutely love!
Really loved this dress! I originally got it for a wedding that I was going to attend but didn't get a chance to wear it. I would definitely rent this again!

Loved this dress and got so many compliments! I have tiny titties and it fit perfect without a bra. The lace part was ankle length in me, but with heels it was perfect for a holiday party. It is right though, so don’t think you will be dancing or doing any kind of free movement in it!

Really bummed cause it looks so cute on the model and other review pics. Couldn’t get this dress past my butt. I was afraid I was going to rip it so just stopped. I think if I could get it past my shoulders or butt would’ve been super cute on but wasn’t willing to take the risk!

I wore this to a fundraiser and was so happy with it! Extremely stretchy and comfortable. I actually sized up because that is all that was available (and I had my eyes on this!) but it was so stretchy that it still fit like a glove :)
I wore it once and I’m in love!

I loved this dress! I saw that it was going to run small, so I ordered a size up and it was perfect. I probably could have made it work in my normal size, but I think sizing up was a better option. This dress is incredibly sexy, but still left a lot up to the imagination. I will probably come back to rent this dress again for a special occasion.

I’m a little bummed bc I’m just now realizing I was sent a M instead of a S. I thought I had ordered a M I was worried about my boobs not fitting into a S but the medium ended up being too long. It’s a tight dress that hugged my body like a glove. I liked the length of the dress but the top half of the dress was too long on me. I think a size S would have been a lot better.

I LOVED this dress! I ordered it on a whim with no specific occasion in mind and unfortunately never got a chance to wear it. It's a very sexy dress - form fitting throughout, cutout below the bust, and sheer towards the bottom. I would have likely paired it with a blazer or leather jacket. I'm between a S and M and the M was just right. S would have been way too tight! Recommend sizing up if you're between sizes

links_reviews_title: not for me but maybe it’s for you!
links_reviews_text: I was excited for this dress and it fit well but I guess trying it on made me realize it’s not for me. I like the top part and how it’s cut. One of the strings came in a not so good condition so I was afraid of it ripping. It’s a nice dress but it just wasn’t for me.

i gave this 5 stars because it's beautiful and deserves it!!! however i would definitely size up, i did thanks to other reviews! the straps adjusted and it had good stretch to it, so comfy. i wore it to a wedding and got so many compliments. 10/10!
Cute fit .

I ordered this dress in a size XS & S since I needed it for a wedding and didn't want to risk getting the wrong size for me. I marked this as true to size because I ended up going with the XS, which is the size I've been wearing more frequently and was the size that looked the best on my body, but boy was it hilarious actually trying both of these dresses on. The waistband is SO TIGHT, regardless of what size you get, and the fabric is double-layered, so trying to get both layers and the band over my chest was a dance. Once on and situated, the waistband stretches out a bit to where it's comfortable and dress keeps you hugged in all night. My favorite part was the peekaboo slit under the chest and I also loved the small bit of lace at the bottom that the under layer didn't hit. It gave the dress a hint of sexy but totally wedding appropriate.

links_reviews_title: She cute, but it ran small
links_reviews_text: Love the brand with my whole heart, and was so excited to get into some 'for love & lemons'. Despite my love for love, I did not wear this dress once, it was mostly bad planning on my part, but also the dress was smaller than what I'd hoped for, but still wearable. Better luck next time.
Loved this dress! Very sexy and tight fitting. I got several compliments on it. Super stretchy but you can’t go running anywhere fast in this one. Small steps needed lol.

The most flattering dress! I wore this to a formal 30th birthday and got so many compliments. It was a little bit hard to get on but once wearing it, very comfortable. So glad I chose this piece and I would definitely recommend it to others. I am usually size XS-S and I chose size XS for this dress.

soooo sassy and form flattering! Wore it to my bday party and got a ton of complements. The dress runs small but has a little stretch. I'm a small B cup so it worked great without a bra but could see this being hard for bigger busts.

Loved this dress. It's very cute and flattering. It is a little sheer, but since it's black it was fine. Definitely couldn't wear a bra, but it was tight enough I was comfortable running around without one. I wore this out on a date and later a girls night for dancing. Not something I'd wear to a wedding, though.

Loved this dress, wore it to a nice dinner with my bf, im usually a small in FL&L and a small or xs in general, however I have wide hips so I got the medium and im glad I did. I maybe would have gotten away with the small but the medium felt comfortable. If you have a larger chest I would say size up because the boob area is smmaaaall.
So beautiful -- felt very confident in it. Fits like a glove but not too tight. Hits great in length.
The dress is extremely tight and has no zipper. I needed help getting it on and off. Even though it is tight, it is a breathable fabric that was comfortable and not restricting.
This was such a fun statement piece. Fit really well.
The dress is cute, but it was rated as smaller than usual so I got a size up - unfortunately it was too big.
I’m 5’1” 114 pounds and the small was so tight. I’m rarely a medium but I wish I sized up!
Super pretty dress, but fit a little wonky- super wide in hips and longer than I would want. Wore to work and had compliments though!

links_reviews_title: Feminine yet...I can’t put my finger on it
links_reviews_text: This dress was very well made - a little worn in and the fabric had beaded up a bit but it was really beautiful and comfortable to wear. I couldn’t wear it again after my niece told me I looked like an extra in a modern day frozen live action. 😐
It was easy to style. I like its 70's vibe.
Runs small and very heavy fabric.
I really liked this! The XS was a tad tight across the chest, but I liked how it hit everywhere else. Very warm, which is perfect for winter in northeast Ohio.

links_reviews_title: Really wanted to like this, but too big
links_reviews_text: I got an XS and this dress still felt too long. Also the fabric is heavy, so combined with the length it really feels like it's weighing you down. Wanted to like this so much for a work/potentially Christmas mass outfit, but never felt comfortable in it.
The sleeves were my favorite and it fit perfectly; it’s just not my style. Wore to office Christmas party and all day at work. Was a stiff cotton and lighter weight than I expected.

I wasn't so sure about this one because of the comments on sizing/etc. I ordered down a little... Usually wear a M/L but went with a M on this. It was a smidge snug in the chest (but I'm larger than most there) and fit great everywhere else. The material is kinda like a thin flannel, which was different than I was expecting but it made it VERY warm, perfect winter dress with brown tights and brown booties. Could dress it up or down. The sleeves have snaps instead of actual button holes, and they come apart with little resistance so that might be annoying if you were moving around a lot in the dress, but it didn't bother me. Got a lot of compliments.
Super cute dress, wore with tights & boots for winter. Cuffs definitely wouldn’t stay fastened on me, but not a huge deal.
I loved the shape of this dress with its nod to 70s flair, but I expected a little more “wow” factor from this particular brand.
Loved the warmer fabric and overall style. The snaps on the sleeves did come un-done a few times but it wasn't bad at all! I wore it with tan booties!

Wanted to love this dress for me but it just didn’t work. I’m 5’11” so i have long arms and legs. The sleeves on this have super cool snaps but they weren’t long enough so they kept popping open. The chest was very snug across my chest and same with shoulders. An adorable dress for the right (smaller) girl.
This dress worked perfectly for fall! The material was a little heavier and was so cute paired with boots

Love the fabric, very different but wasn't a great length for me. If I were to own this I would definitely have it hemmed. Kinda boxy fitting but still would really liked it if it were shorter & may needs some funky Jewerly

This dress is thick and the print is fun but I will say the snaps at the wrist were a little irritating. Cute dress and still a good length for someone who is 5’2. I’m a dd and the girls had enough room.

This was a great dress for work and casual gatherings. My only issue is that the dress itself was worn looking with pilling and therefore, for this reason, I would not spend $172 on a worn dress. Received lots of compliments. Was comfortable
I ordered in a medium, my normal size. The dress had little shape, very large all around, large sleeves, and long in length. Did not wear. Might have worked if I sized down.
The sleeves snap instead of button, so I had to be really careful with how I moved, otherwise they’d unsnap. I wore it mostly with an oversized sweater for that reason.
Loved this cute dress. Warm for fall and a hip retro pattern.

links_reviews_title: cute dress just not for me
links_reviews_text: i dont know, this dress was cute but just not for me. the print is nice but a little too glaring for me

I found the fit of this on me to be frumpy. The bodice is loose, and then it goes down into an even wider A line. It needed to either be loose on top and go down straight, or have a tight bodice and then go into an A line, but not the combo. A belt seems like it would help, but there is too much fabric that gathers when tried to look good.
Love the cut but it was too warm in Cali to wear it
I received so many compliments when I wore the dress. I styled it with knee high boots, booties, and heels. It was my ( and my sweetie’s) favorite this month.

This dress is so cute and easy to wear. The print is elongating for petites and the one I rented (size XS) had no waist seam. The length was ok-hit above the knee-but is probably better for those who are 5’4” and up (I’m 5’1”). The sleeves have a cute puff but the snaps come undone easily. I paired it with clogs for a super easy, vintage-inspired look.
Online it's adorable, in person it falls a little flat. Never ended up wearing it but it could be cute with a wide waist belt...

I loved certain things about this dress, mainly the pattern, which is awesome, and also the neckline and sleeves. I wish it was a true mini, a la Twiggy, or a true midi, but it was awkwardly in between, hitting at the knee 🤔 didn't end up wearing for this reason.

This dress is very pretty and actually fit me ok because I sized down and paid attention to the review that said it was enormous. I got a medium and it fit me ok. I actually did not have the same issue with it that the other ladies on here report with shapelessness. It was form fitting on me, but then again I am pretty curvy. The problem for me was in the sleeves. They looked absolutely ridiculous on me and my petite 5'4" frame and with the thick fabric they definitely gave a really bad Elizabethan look. They were impossible to hide under any blazer or sweater and thus, I could not wear this.

This dress looks deceptively cute in the pictures. Note: the model is holding up the bottom of the dress in two photos and the hem is not pictured in a third. The dress is about 8 inches too long, resulting in this mashup little house on the prairie meets flower child vibe but only in the worst ways.
Heavier fabric then what you would gather from pic and i am generally a 6 and the dress was so big I could not wear. Not a fan.

Great for teller girls (I’m 5’9” and it hits an inch or two above the knee). It’s a thicker, more structured fabric than most, which I find very flattering- but less rigid than canvas/denim. If anything, size up, although I thought it fit TTS

In person, it’s very large and not form-fitting, and the sleeves look Shakespearean. It could look okay under a large coat that covers most of it because it has a cute pattern, but I’m disappointed in the general formlessness of it.

links_reviews_title: Wear this dress if you want compliments
links_reviews_text: The fit of this dress is perfectly flattering. Great for work or wearing out. Thick material so I think it would be great with tights and stay warm in the fall. Would highly recommend if you want to feel cute as you strut down your corporate hallway getting compliments from strangers.

Super cute dress and I get a lot of compliments on it. The only downside I can find is that it runs just a teeeeny bit large and there are 6 snaps, not buttons, on the wrists that come unsnapped about 20 times a day. It's frustrating but other than that, very cute. Sorry the photo is only the top of the dress but it's darling.
I tried it on, but it was massive on me. Material is almost canvas-like. Very unflattering.
I would have bought these if they were high rise. They were definitely more of a mid-rise though. Aside from that, they are great jeans. Don't stretch out at all.

links_reviews_title: Super cute, but too short for me.
links_reviews_text: I rented another pair of Paige jeans from Nuuly that I loved and ended up purchasing so I was super excited to try these because it's hard to find an ankle flare shape that fits my long legs. Sadly, these were the same as all of the others. If your legs are on the longer side (I don't usually wear "tall", but I definitely know what brands/styles work better for me), I would not recommend.
I’ve rented these jeans twice now so I might just need to buy them because I love them so much
I’m normally a 24/25, I got the 25 and couldn’t even get them up past my thighs. Definitely recommend sizing up.
Would be great for someone else
I loved these pants! They were a lighter wash than what I expected, but still cute. I wore these all the time and wish I had purchased them!
Perfect fit and just the right amount of stretch to feel like butter on. So comfortable and style well with any top and any shoes. Wore again and again!

links_reviews_title: Fun jeans that are regular length on petite people
links_reviews_text: They’re supposed to be ankle jeans but they’re regular length on a petite person. I ended up cuffing them to wear as ankle jeans. Not sure I'd consider them flared jeans, more of a bootcut with the amount of volume it has on bottom. The other reviewers are totally spot on with them being stretchy and super comfy though!
Loved these! I couldn't stop wearing them. Comfy, flattering, cute with flats or ankle boots. Ended up purchasing.

I looooved these jeans. They are so comfy and are stretchy without sagging, even after wearing multiple times. I wore them dressed up with heeled booties and a turtleneck bodysuit or dressed down with sneakers and graphic tee. Might have to buy them!
So cute, make your legs look slim and the perfect crop, I loved it so much I bought them!

links_reviews_title: Soft material, but too long for me
links_reviews_text: I really liked the style but they were just a little too long for me. They fit well in the waist and the material was really soft. I couldn't really even roll them though because of the fringe at the bottom, so I just didn't wear them.

I really liked these jeans! I am usually a size 25, but I ordered a size 26 based on the other reviews and I'm so happy I listened. The jeans have little stretch in the sense that they do not stretch out over the course of the day (or after several wears), so I would also recommend going up a size. They are comfortable and hold a nice shape. I am 5'5" so these were okay for me to wear with flats based on where the bottom of the jean hit my leg, but looked a little odd with heeled shoes and booties. I would say they are definitely better for taller people.
Runs big
great fit.
Didn’t make it out the door with these. Not flattering on me. Maybe if I were taller and more leggy!
Highly considered purchasing but I definitely needed one size bigger to fully commit
I loved these jeans SO much and wore them all the time! I always got so many compliments when wearing them and really thought about keeping. They are tts and go with everything!
Love love. I rolled the bottom of these to crop em a little more and probably wore them the maximum about of times I could have. Super comfy.

I wore these jeans almost every day at work. Best fitting pair of jeans I think I've ever owned, and super slimming. Plus they're super comfy and stretchy without stretching out of shape at all. Wanted to buy but just didn't have the funds atm!
These jeans felt like I was wearing sweatpants, so soft and comfortable!
I am obsessed with all Paige jeans. Fit like magic. I will say that for me these were a little long, but I just rolled them at the bottoms.

I wasn't sure how I felt about a cropped flare, but i love them. I love how i can wear them with combat boots when it's cold or sandals when its warm. I love the high rise for my tummy and how good my butt looks in them. I seriously want to buy them.
Cool jeans that look great with a drape-y blouse. These are mid-rise, not high-rise.

links_reviews_title: Purchased after renting 2 months in a row!
links_reviews_text: The length is the perfect crop on my long legs (I'm 5'10") and the slight flare at the bottom balances out my thicker thighs and hides my skinny ankles (eliminating what I call "triangle legs" haha). They look amazing with ankle boots of any kind and fit like a dream. I rented these for 2 months in a row because I enjoyed them so much the first time and ended up buying them this time around since I knew I'd just continue renting them every month otherwise! Pricey for jeans but I wear them 2-3 times a week so it's totally worth it! Fit true to size for me and has a good amount of stretch, so if your like me and have stomach pain with high-waisted jeans, these are great.
I never thought i could pull off a cropped type flare pant and this one changed the game. Fit perfectly, super flattering and made every outfit a little more hip
Love these jeans. Soft as butter, great fit, good look. Versatile piece everyone needs in their closet.

I was so excited about these jeans -- the fit was cute and flattering but unfortunately they were too long. I attempted wearing them with high heel booties but still, they fell at too awkward of a place on my ankle.
I wanted to love these jeans.. but they just didn't fit the way I wanted them to. I'm shorter, and I think the legs were made for taller people.
I would say these run a little small and the waist have no stretch.
Too long for me. Were not cropped whatsoever and looked odd

links_reviews_title: I'd wear them every day if I could
links_reviews_text: I was nervous that they wouldn't fit (I have bad luck with jeans), but they were perfect! I seriously would have worn them every day if I could have. The denim was soft and stretch - but not to the point where it became loose and lost shape after you wore it - the high waist hit at the perfect spot, and the flare and crop with the frayed edge were fun with boots or flats. As soon as I put them on the first time, I knew I wouldn't be giving them back :)

links_reviews_title: I wore the heck outta these!
links_reviews_text: First off, I'm a huge fan of Paige denim. They're always super soft and very comfy. These were no exception! They were a tad tight upon first trying on but after a couple wears they fit like a glove. I really loved the little flare, it looked great paired with a high ankle bootie or vans. Definitely a keeper!
Cute idea but it was a bit too tight on me. The cut of the bell bottoms were a little off too. Have to wear with sock boots.

links_reviews_title: A bit too long for petite people like me
links_reviews_text: Good fabric, good stretching but a bit long

These are some of the best jeans I've worn in while! I have a difficult time finding jeans that fit my body well. These were so comfortable, stretchy and soft. They fit perfectly. They are a bit longer than what they seem in the photo but they are perfect with booties.

These were just your basic pair of black jeans. Nothing special about them. I sized down after reading the reviews and wish that I didn't. They were too tight around the waist for me. I still wore them a few times, but they were uncomfortable. I also didn't like how short they were. I know they were supposed to hit at the ankle but it looked weird and was uncomfortable in the cold weather.

links_reviews_title: Cute but just not my favorite cut of pant
links_reviews_text: I had been wanting to try this cut of pant - ankle flare jean, because I wanted something to wear with a boot that wasn't super wide, or super tight on the ankle. Thought this would work but just wasn't loving the tight cropped flare, I think as a short gal, the crop doesn't always fit as a crop so I think that throws me off. Cute just not my fav
Because I'm short, the jeans didn't look as cute on as on the model as they went to the floor and I typically wear flats. Super comfy though!

links_reviews_title: LOVE THE LOOK - Learned to size down
links_reviews_text: If you are thinking about these, get them! I wore them often with boots and a western style belt. I wore em EVERYWHERE.

im usually a 26-28. these fit so great. i dont really have a butt and these give me a nice shape. perfect with my go to bodysuits. so obv had to purchase. too cute and great fit if youre like me with more of a straight shaped body.
They were great! Exactly how they looked in the photos. Slightly stretchy and with a medium rise. I wore them with boots and loved the overall look.

links_reviews_title: Comfy, would double check the length
links_reviews_text: These fit true to size in the waist and legs and the denim is soft and comfortable while still maintaining structure which I love! Unfortunately on me the hem falls too low, veering toward bootcut instead of ankle crop as pictured, even though I'm not short (5'8). Might be fixed with taller boots.

So much potential! But the neck just falls open so all my pretty lady boobs show, but the waist is too snug.
Top half of dress runs very large.

links_reviews_title: Not a good fit for petite

Great pair of stretchy, jean leggings! So cute! I received lots of compliments!!!!

links_reviews_title: a good fit for long legs

links_reviews_title: Liked the style, but didn't love the fit

couldn't really figure out the vibe of these. the cuffs were pretty tattered too which wasn't apparent in the pic and made them look even more sloppy (they already have a sporty vibe with the stripes and soft stretchy material). didn't love.
Great black pant w a twist. Casual and comfortable.

links_reviews_title: Stretchy, Comfy, and can be casual or cool!

I wanted to like it more then I did. Just bit low rise for my body type or preference

links_reviews_title: Great but a little short on taller people

Absolutely loved these! I ended up buying them. They are super comfy.

links_reviews_title: Comfy...but only get if you love low-rise

Lots of stretch but very comfortable and cute
Wish these pants could have worked out! The ends of the pants were fraying.
I don't personally find the fit of these flattering. Wish they were more high-rise. They were almost low-rise.

Loved everything about these pants! Super soft and comfy!
Loved the contrast stripe! Not just another plan black jean. These had nice stretch but still seemed slightly too small. Also, wished they were slightly higher waist.
These have a stretchy waist band and would fit a lot of different shapes. There are the perfect pant to rent for that reason. Loved them. Might buy.
These are cute. Will stretch out after they are on you for a bit may need to size down. Wasted stretched and slipped down so I needed a belt. Stitching on stripe was going undone.
I was the most excited about these, but they ended up being waaay too low cut. Think early 2000s hip-hugger. They were also way stretchier and flimsier than I expected. Not flattering at all.
Per other reviews size down

These would be super cute but it was too big and I didn’t like the way it fit - risk you take with pants though!
I love these jeans I could wear them everyday so comfy!! Wore them out to brunch with friends and also a few times as an everyday jean!!

These are super cute. I read the reviews that said they ran large so I sized down. They fit, but were still to stretchy for me as they were lower cut and I had to keep pulling them up. Ended up not wearing them. These would probably be better for someone that doesn't have wide hips :)

I really liked the idea of these pants, but I went for a smaller size (26) since they didn’t have mine in stock (27). A friend ended up wearing them for the month and they were super cute on her! Next time, I’ll just wait for my size :)
these fit super well. They were pretty stretchy so they helped suck me it but werent too tight. They looked cute and i got lots of compliments. Didnt fall down and made my butt look cute
Fit was great but really low waisted. Fun Jeans to wear!
These are easily the most comfortable pair of jeans I have ever worn. They stretched to fit me perfectly, and the length is just right. They are perfect with a graphic tee or any fall top. LOVE!

These jeans are super comfortable. They're also super stretchy. I'm usually a 30 but that wasn't available so I went with a 31. They were wearable but a bit too big. The 30 or 29 even would have been better. Loved the racing stripe detail.
I loved these jeans, they’re fun and sporty and I wore them a lot with a t shirt and sneakers. My only complaint is that they stretched out quite a bit after I wore them once.
Comfortable and cool.

would probably size down just because they are pretty stretchy! really comfy though and i got tons of compliments. the stripes are definitely more cream/less white than they look in the pics as a heads up

The rest of the comments have truth, however I sized up and LOVED this dress. So fun and unique. I have broad shoulders and the 4 fit perfect

links_reviews_title: Not as great as I expected

links_reviews_title: So cute but a little tight in the arms.

links_reviews_title: So Excited about this but it didn't fit right.

I wish it would have worked.

links_reviews_title: It's very beautiful, but it runs extremely small! Maybe I just got the wrong size!

links_reviews_title: How can a dress be so tight and so loose

fit my lower body great but the arm holes were wayy too small. if you have bigger/muscley arms this dress will be tight up top.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous but didn’t fit at all :(

links_reviews_title: to big in the waist and hips, ok in the arms

I ordered the M since I typically wear there size but this dress was just a little too big. I thought maybe I would just ignore that fact, and maybe that would have been ok, except the shoulders were so fitted and then the rest of this beautiful dress was too baggy over my body.

links_reviews_title: So chic but so weird fitting
links_reviews_text: Like everyone else has said, the fabric across the shoulders makes the dress so tight and immobile in this area. Not for dancing or any situation in which you will have to raise your arms. Controversy, the waistline in the size I got was a bit loose. However, I found this dress to be very chic and unique on, and could overlook the sizing weirdness for a fancy dinner or party. I'm probably going to wear this to my birthday dinner, but change into something more comfortable for dancing!

I wore this to a holiday party and got a lot of compliments. It fit almost like a glove and was really cute! I have narrow shoulders, and I would absolutely not recommend this for a person with wider shoulders. This is made of nonstretch fabrics; I really had to shimmy into it. The only slight fit issue, also visible in the retail photo, is that the front bodice is a little too wide above the bust, even though I was filling out the bust and shoulders. Its fully lined and quite beautifully constructed. The large keyhole demands some kind of convertible bra. I love the color story and wacky fabric combo. I’d be so thrilled to see more Kim Shui & similar indie designers available on Nuuly.

links_reviews_title: Made really weird, body runs big arms and chest runs small

links_reviews_title: Cute style, tight and short tho

Beautiful dress, but the rumors are true... Runs small in the shoulders and arms. I couldn't make it work.

Loved these! Fit nice on the booty but still very comfy! True to size
Basic jeans like the top detail, had a mom jean fit. True to size

had potential but too tight around the thighs and too loose around the waist. overall weird fit. wouldn't recommend for curvy shaped girls unless getting a bigger size than the usual.

links_reviews_title: So cute! Got so, so many compliments

Easy to wear, fun print.

better for someone taller and in colder weather because the jeans are so thick.

links_reviews_title: Maybe I ordered the wrong size.

links_reviews_title: super comfy with a great fit
links_reviews_text: Love these jeans! They're super soft with a little bit of stretch and fit perfectly. I really wanted to love these and wear them all the time because they're super cool, but the reality was that the bunching made them unflattering on me. These were great weekend daytime jeans. Fit well, comfortable, and the zippers gave them a cute flare. I tried to dress them up for nighttime, but they always felt too casual with the tops I had.

links_reviews_title: If only they were my size!

pretty but wore the jumpsuit instead

links_reviews_title: While it did not fit me, it looked great on my petite sister
